TopicTitle: The Most Important Mod Request I Have Ever Made.

Articles.Content:
Kerbals should, naa... MUST make a "rubber ducky"/"dog squeak toy" sound when they hit the ground. Something similar to a sharp squeeze.

Danny2462 example

I know its just a little thing, but it fits the kerbal genre perfectly (in my humble, but correct opinion). Its the little things that can add a lot to a game.

Here are some examples:

http://www.audioblocks.com/search/?srch-term=dog+toy&srch-type=all

http://www.pond5.com/sound-effect/46022073/dog-squeeze-toy-1.html

One bounce sound effect may not be enough. We may need a whole slew of them. Bouncing high, bouncing low, bouncing on the mun, bouncing fast, bouncing slow. I can't possibly list them all here.

If you agree (and how couldn't you?), please leave a link to the sound effect that most fits a kerbal bouncing.

EDIT: GreeningGalaxy suggested that 'Bonus points if kerbal death leaves a lingering "SQUEEeeee.e..e." deflating sound in the air behind it.' ROFL

A couple ideas:

[[http://www.soundsnap.com/tags/deflate]]

[[http://www.freesfx.co.uk/soundeffects/balloon/]]

Maybe a balloon popping sound might also be appropriate.

Edited June 12, 2015 by Probus
Additional sound FX

Collision FX adds an "Oof" sound when Kerbals hit the ground... Someone requested the same "squeak" sound that you're asking, and the community delivered

Relevant posts:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-05-14%29-Now-with-EVA-kerbal-sound-effects%21?p=1906254&viewfull=1#post1906254

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-05-14%29-Now-with-EVA-kerbal-sound-effects%21?p=1915448&viewfull=1#post1915448
Oh my god that is the greatest idea ever made...how did I not think of it before now??
Their steps also should add a quiet rubber ducky sound too
And replace the Kerbal texture with a rubber duckey one....
This is amazing! I installed Collision FX just for the squeakies.
